meanings.sent1: The jar tains candies for the party.
meanings.sent2: The box tains all my old toys.
meanings.sent3: The backpack tains a surprise for you.
meanings.sent4: Her heart tains a world of love.
meanings.sent5: The basket tains fresh fruits and vegetables.

meanings.definition: To have as an element or constituent part
meanings.sent1: The recipe tains sugar for sweetness.
meanings.sent2: The team tains players of all ages.
meanings.sent3: The story tains a twist at the end.
meanings.sent4: His speech tains words of wisdom.

meanings.sent1: She tains the key to the treasure chest.
meanings.sent3: The cat tains the best spot on the couch.
meanings.sent4: The farmer tains the land for generations.
meanings.sent5: The artist tains his masterpiece in the studio.

meanings.sent1: The king tains a golden crown.
meanings.sent2: The child tains a curious mind.
meanings.sent3: The explorer tains a map of uncharted lands.
meanings.sent4: The musician tains a talent for playing instruments.
meanings.sent5: The garden tains a variety of flowers.

meanings.definition: To be capable of holding or containing
meanings.sent1: The cup tains water for drinking.
meanings.sent2: The bucket tains sand for building castles.
meanings.sent3: The cloud tains rain for the thirsty earth.
meanings.sent4: The fridge tains food for the family.
meanings.sent5: The jar tains memories of happy times.
